TGuidHelper Class Helper

Summary

Represents a record helper for the System.TGuid structure to make it easy to use.

Namespace: Spring.Helpers
Syntax
Delphi
type
 TGuidHelper = record helper for TGuid
 end;
Properties
 NameDescription
Empty

Gets the shared empty guid.

IsEmpty

Gets a value which indicates whether the guid is empty (all zero).

Top
Methods
 NameDescription

Overloaded. Represents method Create(Cardinal,Word,Word,Byte,Byte,Byte,Byte,Byte,Byte,Byte,Byte).

Create(Integer,SmallInt,SmallInt,Byte,Byte,Byte,Byte,Byte,Byte,Byte,Byte)

Overloaded. Represents method Create(Integer,SmallInt,SmallInt,Byte,Byte,Byte,Byte,Byte,Byte,Byte,Byte).

Create(Integer,SmallInt,SmallInt,TBytes)

Overloaded. Represents method Create(Integer,SmallInt,SmallInt,TBytes).

Create(string)

Overloaded. Creates a guid structure from the specified guid string.

Create(TBytes)

Overloaded. Represents method Create(TBytes).

Equals(TGuid)

Determines whether the guid equals to another TGuid structure.

NewGuid

Generates a new TGuid instance.

ToByteArray

Represents method ToByteArray.

ToBytes

Represents method ToBytes.

ToQuotedString

Returns the quoted string representation of the guid.

ToString

Returns a string representation of the guid.

Top
Remarks

Tip

You can use the equal ("=") or not equal ("<>") operator loading in latest Delphi XE.

Examples

The following code demonstrates how to create a new guid and use it in OO-style:

Delphi
procedure TestGuidHelper;
var
  guid: TGuid;
begin
  // generates a new guid.
  guid := TGuid.NewGuid;
  // this guid must not be empty.
  Assert(not guid.IsEmpty);
  // print the string representation
  Writeln(guid.ToString);
  // print the quoted string
  Writeln(guid.ToQuotedString);
  // This guid must equal to itself.
  Assert(guid.Equals(guid));
end;
